intro: Achimenes cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf achimenes, is a tropical perennial plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant thrives in warm, humid conditions and is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms. It produces its flowers during the summer months and is known for its ability to climb or trail when supported.
